TITLE: Registering a Custom Dataset in Detectron2 DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to register a custom dataset with Detectron2 by implementing a function that returns dataset items and registering it with DatasetCatalog. The function should return a list of dictionaries containing dataset information. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/docs/tutorials/datasets.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` def my_dataset_function(): ... return list[dict] in the following format from detectron2.data import DatasetCatalog DatasetCatalog.register("my_dataset", my_dataset_function) # later, to access the data: data: List[Dict] = DatasetCatalog.get("my_dataset") ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Custom Metadata to a Dataset in Detectron2 DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to add metadata to a custom dataset using MetadataCatalog. This snippet demonstrates adding 'thing_classes' which defines the names of object categories for detection tasks. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/docs/tutorials/datasets.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from detectron2.data import MetadataCatalog MetadataCatalog.get("my_dataset").thing_classes = ["person", "dog"] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Inference Demo with Pre-trained Model DESCRIPTION: Command to run inference using Detectron2's demo script with a pre-trained Mask R-CNN model. Supports input from images, webcam, or video with various configuration options. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/GETTING_STARTED.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` cd demo/ python demo.py --config-file ../configs/COCO-InstanceSegmentation/mask_rcnn_R_50_FPN_3x.yaml \ --input input1.jpg input2.jpg \ [--other-options] --opts MODEL.WEIGHTS detectron2://COCO-InstanceSegmentation/mask_rcnn_R_50_FPN_3x/137849600/model_final_f10217.pkl ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Registering a Custom Backbone in Detectron2 DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to create and register a custom backbone architecture with Detectron2. It implements a simple ToyBackbone class that follows the Backbone interface and registers it in the BACKBONE_REGISTRY for use in configuration files. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/docs/tutorials/write-models.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from detectron2.modeling import BACKBONE_REGISTRY, Backbone, ShapeSpec @BACKBONE_REGISTRY.register() class ToyBackbone(Backbone): def __init__(self, cfg, input_shape): super().__init__() # create your own backbone self.conv1 = nn.Conv2d(3, 64, kernel_size=7, stride=16, padding=3) def forward(self, image): return {"conv1": self.conv1(image)} def output_shape(self): return {"conv1": ShapeSpec(channels=64, stride=16)} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using a Custom Backbone in Detectron2 Configuration DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to reference and use a custom backbone component in a Detectron2 configuration. It sets the MODEL.BACKBONE.NAME to the custom ToyBackbone class name, allowing the build_model function to find and use the previously registered implementation. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/docs/tutorials/write-models.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` cfg = ... # read a config cfg.MODEL.BACKBONE.NAME = 'ToyBackbone' # or set it in the config file model = build_model(cfg) # it will find `ToyBackbone` defined above ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Detectron2 from GitHub Source DESCRIPTION: Commands to install Detectron2 directly from the GitHub repository or from a local clone. Includes special instructions for macOS users who may need to specify environment variables. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/docs/tutorials/install.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` python -m pip install 'git+https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2.git' # (add --user if you don't have permission) # Or, to install it from a local clone: git clone https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2.git python -m pip install -e detectron2 # On macOS, you may need to prepend the above commands with a few environment variables: CC=clang CXX=clang++ ARCHFLAGS="-arch x86_64" python -m pip install ... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Inference with Pre-trained Mask R-CNN Model in Detectron2 DESCRIPTION: Command for running inference using demo.py with a pre-trained Mask R-CNN model on input images. The command specifies the config file, input images, and model weights from Detectron2's model zoo. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/docs/tutorials/getting_started.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` cd demo/ python demo.py --config-file ../configs/COCO-InstanceSegmentation/mask_rcnn_R_50_FPN_3x.yaml \ --input input1.jpg input2.jpg \ [--other-options] --opts MODEL.WEIGHTS detectron2://COCO-InstanceSegmentation/mask_rcnn_R_50_FPN_3x/137849600/model_final_f10217.pkl ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Initializing Mask R-CNN Model with Config DESCRIPTION: Simple initialization of a Mask R-CNN model using a configuration file loaded from YAML. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/docs/tutorials/extend.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` # load proper yaml config file, then model = build_model(cfg) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Usage of Detectron2's Augmentation System DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to define a sequence of augmentations, prepare input data, apply augmentations, and transform additional data types. Shows the core workflow with AugmentationList, AugInput, and Transform classes. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/docs/tutorials/augmentation.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from detectron2.data import transforms as T # Define a sequence of augmentations: augs = T.AugmentationList([ T.RandomBrightness(0.9, 1.1), T.RandomFlip(prob=0.5), T.RandomCrop("absolute", (640, 640)) ]) # type: T.Augmentation # Define the augmentation input ("image" required, others optional): input = T.AugInput(image, boxes=boxes, sem_seg=sem_seg) # Apply the augmentation: transform = augs(input) # type: T.Transform image_transformed = input.image # new image sem_seg_transformed = input.sem_seg # new semantic segmentation # For any extra data that needs to be augmented together, use transform, e.g.: image2_transformed = transform.apply_image(image2) polygons_transformed = transform.apply_polygons(polygons) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Training Detectron2 Model with Multiple GPUs DESCRIPTION: Command for training a Mask R-CNN model using train_net.py with 8 GPUs. The script uses the default configuration file for Mask R-CNN with ResNet-50 FPN backbone trained for 1x schedule. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/docs/tutorials/getting_started.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` cd tools/ ./train_net.py --num-gpus 8 \ --config-file ../configs/COCO-InstanceSegmentation/mask_rcnn_R_50_FPN_1x.yaml ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Training Detectron2 Model with Single GPU DESCRIPTION: Command for training a Mask R-CNN model on a single GPU with adjusted hyperparameters. The batch size and learning rate are modified to accommodate single-GPU training based on research recommendations. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/docs/tutorials/getting_started.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ./train_net.py \ --config-file ../configs/COCO-InstanceSegmentation/mask_rcnn_R_50_FPN_1x.yaml \ --num-gpus 1 SOLVER.IMS_PER_BATCH 2 SOLVER.BASE_LR 0.0025 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Custom Counter Evaluator in Python DESCRIPTION: Example implementation of a custom DatasetEvaluator that counts detected instances in the validation set. Shows the basic structure with reset(), process(), and evaluate() methods. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/docs/tutorials/evaluation.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` class Counter(DatasetEvaluator): def reset(self): self.count = 0 def process(self, inputs, outputs): for output in outputs: self.count += len(output["instances"]) def evaluate(self): # save self.count somewhere, or print it, or return it. return {"count": self.count} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Evaluating a Trained Detectron2 Model DESCRIPTION: Command for evaluating a previously trained Detectron2 model using train_net.py in evaluation-only mode. The command specifies the configuration file and path to the model checkpoint. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/docs/tutorials/getting_started.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ./train_net.py \ --config-file ../configs/COCO-InstanceSegmentation/mask_rcnn_R_50_FPN_1x.yaml \ --eval-only MODEL.WEIGHTS /path/to/checkpoint_file ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Training Detectron2 Model on Multiple GPUs DESCRIPTION: Command to train a Detectron2 model using 8 GPUs with the default configuration for Mask R-CNN. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/GETTING_STARTED.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` cd tools/ ./train_net.py --num-gpus 8 \ --config-file ../configs/COCO-InstanceSegmentation/mask_rcnn_R_50_FPN_1x.yaml ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Evaluating Detectron2 Model Performance DESCRIPTION: Command to evaluate a trained model's performance using a specific checkpoint file. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/GETTING_STARTED.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ./train_net.py \ --config-file ../configs/COCO-InstanceSegmentation/mask_rcnn_R_50_FPN_1x.yaml \ --eval-only MODEL.WEIGHTS /path/to/checkpoint_file ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Loading a Python Config File with LazyConfig in Detectron2 DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to define a config file in Python and load it using LazyConfig.load(). The resulting cfg object is an omegaconf dictionary that can be accessed using dot notation. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/docs/tutorials/lazyconfigs.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` # config.py: a = dict(x=1, y=2, z=dict(xx=1)) b = dict(x=3, y=4) # my_code.py: from detectron2.config import LazyConfig cfg = LazyConfig.load("path/to/config.py") # an omegaconf dictionary assert cfg.a.z.xx == 1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing a Custom Mapper Function for Detectron2 Dataloader DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to implement a custom mapper function when the default DatasetMapper is not sufficient. It implements a minimal mapper that reads images, resizes them to 800x800, and transforms annotations accordingly. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/docs/tutorials/data_loading.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from detectron2.data import detection_utils as utils # Show how to implement a minimal mapper, similar to the default DatasetMapper def mapper(dataset_dict): dataset_dict = copy.deepcopy(dataset_dict) # it will be modified by code below # can use other ways to read image image = utils.read_image(dataset_dict["file_name"], format="BGR") # See "Data Augmentation" tutorial for details usage auginput = T.AugInput(image) transform = T.Resize((800, 800))(auginput) image = torch.from_numpy(auginput.image.transpose(2, 0, 1)) annos = [ utils.transform_instance_annotations(annotation, [transform], image.shape[1:]) for annotation in dataset_dict.pop("annotations") ] return { # create the format that the model expects "image": image, "instances": utils.annotations_to_instances(annos, image.shape[1:]) } dataloader = build_detection_train_loader(cfg, mapper=mapper) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Registering New Data Types for Transforms DESCRIPTION: Shows how to extend the transform system to support new data types beyond the built-in ones. The example demonstrates registering a custom handler for rotated bounding boxes with horizontal flipping. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/docs/tutorials/augmentation.md#2025-04-21_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` @T.HFlipTransform.register_type("rotated_boxes") def func(flip_transform: T.HFlipTransform, rotated_boxes: Any): # do the work return flipped_rotated_boxes t = HFlipTransform(width=800) transformed_rotated_boxes = t.apply_rotated_boxes(rotated_boxes) # func will be called ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Partial Model Execution in Detectron2 DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to partially execute a model to obtain intermediate features, specifically mask features before mask head. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/docs/tutorials/models.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` images = ImageList.from_tensors(...) # preprocessed input tensor model = build_model(cfg) model.eval() features = model.backbone(images.tensor) proposals, _ = model.proposal_generator(images, features) instances, _ = model.roi_heads(images, features, proposals) mask_features = [features[f] for f in model.roi_heads.in_features] mask_features = model.roi_heads.mask_pooler(mask_features, [x.pred_boxes for x in instances]) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Inference with Detectron2 Models DESCRIPTION: Shows how to perform inference using a model in evaluation mode with gradient computation disabled. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/docs/tutorials/models.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` model.eval() with torch.no_grad(): outputs = model(inputs) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing Detectron2 Model Registries DESCRIPTION: Lists various model registries provided by Detectron2 for customizing components. These registries allow users to replace default components with custom implementations without modifying the core code. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/docs/modules/modeling.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: Python CODE: ``` .. autodata:: detectron2.modeling.META_ARCH_REGISTRY .. autodata:: detectron2.modeling.BACKBONE_REGISTRY .. autodata:: detectron2.modeling.PROPOSAL_GENERATOR_REGISTRY .. autodata:: detectron2.modeling.RPN_HEAD_REGISTRY .. autodata:: detectron2.modeling.ANCHOR_GENERATOR_REGISTRY .. autodata:: detectron2.modeling.ROI_HEADS_REGISTRY .. autodata:: detectron2.modeling.ROI_BOX_HEAD_REGISTRY .. autodata:: detectron2.modeling.ROI_MASK_HEAD_REGISTRY .. autodata:: detectron2.modeling.ROI_KEYPOINT_HEAD_REGISTRY ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Building Model from Config in Detectron2 DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to build a model structure from a yacs config object using the build_model function. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/docs/tutorials/models.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from detectron2.modeling import build_model model = build_model(cfg) # returns a torch.nn.Module ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Custom Transform Strategy for Keypoints DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates an advanced usage where transform operations are inspected to apply domain-specific logic for keypoint annotations, such as swapping left/right keypoints after horizontal flipping. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/docs/tutorials/augmentation.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` # augs, input are defined as in previous examples transform = augs(input) # type: T.Transform keypoints_xy = transform.apply_coords(keypoints_xy) # transform the coordinates # get a list of all transforms that were applied transforms = T.TransformList([transform]).transforms # check if it is flipped for odd number of times do_hflip = sum(isinstance(t, T.HFlipTransform) for t in transforms) % 2 == 1 if do_hflip: keypoints_xy = keypoints_xy[flip_indices_mapping] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: HTML Table for Faster R-CNN Model Performance Metrics DESCRIPTION: HTML table displaying performance metrics for various Faster R-CNN models with different backbones (R50, R101, X101) and feature extractors (C4, DC5, FPN). Includes training schedules, speed metrics, memory usage, and AP scores with model download links. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/MODEL_ZOO.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ```
Name lr
sched		 train
time
(s/iter)		 inference
time
(s/im)		 train
mem
(GB)		 box
AP		 model id download
R50-C4 1x 0.551 0.102 4.8 35.7 137257644 model | metrics

R50-FPN 1x 0.210 0.038 3.0 37.9 137257794 model | metrics
R50-C4 3x 0.543 0.104 4.8 38.4 137849393 model | metrics
R50-DC5 3x 0.378 0.070 5.0 39.0 137849425 model | metrics
R50-FPN 3x 0.209 0.038 3.0 40.2 137849458 model | metrics
R101-C4 3x 0.619 0.139 5.9 41.1 138204752 model | metrics
R101-DC5 3x 0.452 0.086 6.1 40.6 138204841 model | metrics
R101-FPN 3x 0.286 0.051 4.1 42.0 137851257 model | metrics
X101-FPN 3x 0.638 0.098 6.7 43.0 139173657 model | metrics
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Custom ROI Heads with Explicit Arguments in Detectron2 DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to modify a Faster R-CNN model by creating custom ROI heads with explicit arguments. It shows how to instantiate StandardROIHeads with a custom box predictor implementation to use custom loss functions while keeping other components unchanged. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/docs/tutorials/write-models.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` roi_heads = StandardROIHeads( cfg, backbone.output_shape(), box_predictor=MyRCNNOutput(...) ) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Loading and Saving Model Checkpoints in Detectron2 DESCRIPTION: Shows how to load existing checkpoints and save new ones using DetectionCheckpointer class. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/docs/tutorials/models.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from detectron2.checkpoint import DetectionCheckpointer DetectionCheckpointer(model).load(file_path_or_url) # load a file, usually from cfg.MODEL.WEIGHTS checkpointer = DetectionCheckpointer(model, save_dir="output") checkpointer.save("model_999") # save to output/model_999.pth ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Viewing LazyConfig Structure in Detectron2 DESCRIPTION: Shows how to view the structure of a LazyConfig object by converting it to a Python dictionary, which is useful for understanding and modifying complex configurations. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/docs/tutorials/lazyconfigs.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from detectron2.model_zoo import get_config from detectron2.config import LazyConfig print(LazyConfig.to_py(get_config("COCO-InstanceSegmentation/mask_rcnn_R_50_FPN_1x.py"))) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Custom Color and Resize Augmentations DESCRIPTION: Shows how to implement new augmentations by subclassing T.Augmentation and implementing the get_transform method. Includes examples for color transformation and custom resizing. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/docs/tutorials/augmentation.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` class MyColorAugmentation(T.Augmentation): def get_transform(self, image): r = np.random.rand(2) return T.ColorTransform(lambda x: x * r[0] + r[1] * 10) class MyCustomResize(T.Augmentation): def get_transform(self, image): old_h, old_w = image.shape[:2] new_h, new_w = int(old_h * np.random.rand()), int(old_w * 1.5) return T.ResizeTransform(old_h, old_w, new_h, new_w) augs = MyCustomResize() transform = augs(input) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring DensePose R-101-FPN Model with Legacy Schedule in YAML DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration for a DensePose R-101-FPN model using the legacy training schedule. This defines the model architecture, training parameters, and evaluation metrics for a deeper backbone. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/projects/DensePose/doc/DENSEPOSE_IUV.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` densepose_rcnn_R_101_FPN_s1x_legacy ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: COCO Dataset Structure for Instance/Keypoint Detection DESCRIPTION: Defines the expected directory structure for COCO instance and keypoint detection datasets including annotation files and image directories. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/datasets/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` coco/ annotations/ instances_{train,val}2017.json person_keypoints_{train,val}2017.json {train,val}2017/ # image files that are mentioned in the corresponding json ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Command Line Config Override for Detectron2 Demo DESCRIPTION: Shows how to override config values via command line arguments in Detectron2's demo script. Demonstrates setting model weights and input size test parameters. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/docs/tutorials/configs.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ./demo.py --config-file config.yaml [--other-options] \ --opts MODEL.WEIGHTS /path/to/weights INPUT.MIN_SIZE_TEST 1000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Customizing Detectron2 Dataloader with Fixed Image Size DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to customize the Detectron2 dataloader by using the default DatasetMapper with a custom transformation that resizes all images to a fixed size (800x800) during training. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/docs/tutorials/data_loading.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` import detectron2.data.transforms as T from detectron2.data import DatasetMapper # the default mapper dataloader = build_detection_train_loader(cfg, mapper=DatasetMapper(cfg, is_train=True, augmentations=[ T.Resize((800, 800)) ])) # use this dataloader instead of the default ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Training Cascade Mask R-CNN Models in Detectron2 DESCRIPTION: Command to train Cascade Mask R-CNN models using the lazyconfig_train_net.py tool in Detectron2. This executes training with the specified configuration file using 64 GPUs by default with a batch size of 64. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/projects/ViTDet/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` ../../tools/lazyconfig_train_net.py --config-file configs/path/to/config.py ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Detectron2 Dataset Directory DESCRIPTION: Sets the environment variable for the location of Detectron2 datasets. This determines where Detectron2 will look for dataset files. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/docs/tutorials/builtin_datasets.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` export DETECTRON2_DATASETS=/path/to/datasets ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing Detectron2 Modeling Module DESCRIPTION: Imports the detectron2.modeling module and its members. This module is the main entry point for Detectron2's modeling functionality. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/docs/modules/modeling.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Python CODE: ``` .. automodule:: detectron2.modeling :members: :undoc-members: :show-inheritance: ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Inverting Transforms for Inference Results DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to invert applied augmentations to map prediction results back to the original image space, particularly useful for segmentation masks or other dense predictions. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/docs/tutorials/augmentation.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` transform = augs(input) pred_mask = make_prediction(input.image) inv_transform = transform.inverse() pred_mask_orig = inv_transform.apply_segmentation(pred_mask) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Evaluating Panoptic-DeepLab Model on Cityscapes Dataset DESCRIPTION: This command evaluates a trained Panoptic-DeepLab model on the Cityscapes dataset. It specifies the configuration file and the path to the model checkpoint. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/projects/Panoptic-DeepLab/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` cd /path/to/detectron2/projects/Panoptic-DeepLab python train_net.py --config-file configs/Cityscapes-PanopticSegmentation/panoptic_deeplab_R_52_os16_mg124_poly_90k_bs32_crop_512_1024_dsconv.yaml --eval-only MODEL.WEIGHTS /path/to/model_checkpoint ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Initializing Mask R-CNN with Full Explicit Arguments DESCRIPTION: Detailed initialization of a Mask R-CNN model using fully explicit arguments, including backbone, proposal generator, ROI heads, and pixel normalization parameters. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/docs/tutorials/extend.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` model = GeneralizedRCNN( backbone=FPN( ResNet( BasicStem(3, 64, norm="FrozenBN"), ResNet.make_default_stages(50, stride_in_1x1=True, norm="FrozenBN"), out_features=["res2", "res3", "res4", "res5"], ).freeze(2), ["res2", "res3", "res4", "res5"], 256, top_block=LastLevelMaxPool(), ), proposal_generator=RPN( in_features=["p2", "p3", "p4", "p5", "p6"], head=StandardRPNHead(in_channels=256, num_anchors=3), anchor_generator=DefaultAnchorGenerator( sizes=[[32], [64], [128], [256], [512]], aspect_ratios=[0.5, 1.0, 2.0], strides=[4, 8, 16, 32, 64], offset=0.0, ), anchor_matcher=Matcher([0.3, 0.7], [0, -1, 1], allow_low_quality_matches=True), box2box_transform=Box2BoxTransform([1.0, 1.0, 1.0, 1.0]), batch_size_per_image=256, positive_fraction=0.5, pre_nms_topk=(2000, 1000), post_nms_topk=(1000, 1000), nms_thresh=0.7, ), roi_heads=StandardROIHeads( num_classes=80, batch_size_per_image=512, positive_fraction=0.25, proposal_matcher=Matcher([0.5], [0, 1], allow_low_quality_matches=False), box_in_features=["p2", "p3", "p4", "p5"], box_pooler=ROIPooler(7, (1.0 / 4, 1.0 / 8, 1.0 / 16, 1.0 / 32), 0, "ROIAlignV2"), box_head=FastRCNNConvFCHead( ShapeSpec(channels=256, height=7, width=7), conv_dims=[], fc_dims=[1024, 1024] ), box_predictor=FastRCNNOutputLayers( ShapeSpec(channels=1024), test_score_thresh=0.05, box2box_transform=Box2BoxTransform((10, 10, 5, 5)), num_classes=80, ), mask_in_features=["p2", "p3", "p4", "p5"], mask_pooler=ROIPooler(14, (1.0 / 4, 1.0 / 8, 1.0 / 16, 1.0 / 32), 0, "ROIAlignV2"), mask_head=MaskRCNNConvUpsampleHead( ShapeSpec(channels=256, width=14, height=14), num_classes=80, conv_dims=[256, 256, 256, 256, 256], ), ), pixel_mean=[103.530, 116.280, 123.675], pixel_std=[1.0, 1.0, 1.0], input_format="BGR", ) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Training TensorMask BiPyramid with ResNet-50 on Multiple GPUs DESCRIPTION: Specific command to train a TensorMask model with BiPyramid and ResNet-50 backbone using 1x schedule on 8 GPUs. This is an example of a complete training command with specific configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/docs/tutorials/write-models.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` @ROI_HEADS_REGISTRY.register() class MyStandardROIHeads(StandardROIHeads): def __init__(self, cfg, input_shape): super().__init__(cfg, input_shape, box_predictor=MyRCNNOutput(...)) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Basic Detectron2 Dataset Structure DESCRIPTION: Shows the basic directory structure required for Detectron2's builtin datasets under the DETECTRON2_DATASETS environment variable. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/docs/tutorials/configs.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from detectron2.config import get_cfg cfg = get_cfg() # obtain detectron2's default config cfg.xxx = yyy # add new configs for your own custom components cfg.merge_from_file("my_cfg.yaml") # load values from a file cfg.merge_from_list(["MODEL.WEIGHTS", "weights.pth"]) # can also load values from a list of str print(cfg.dump()) # print formatted configs with open("output.yaml", "w") as f: f.write(cfg.dump()) # save config to file ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Training Models with EventStorage in Detectron2 DESCRIPTION: Example of using EventStorage context manager for model training to capture training statistics. SOURCE: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/main/docs/tutorials/augmentation.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` transform = augs(input) # type: T.TransformList assert isinstance(transform, T.TransformList) for t in transform.transforms: keypoints_xy = t.apply_coords(keypoints_xy) visibility &= (keypoints_xy >= [0, 0] & keypoints_xy <= [W, H]).all(axis=1) # btw, detectron2's `transform_keypoint_annotations` function chooses to label such keypoints "visible": # keypoints_xy = transform.apply_coords(keypoints_xy) # visibility &= (keypoints_xy >= [0, 0] & keypoints_xy <= [W, H]).all(axis=1) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: DensePose CSE Feature List DESCRIPTION: Markdown list detailing the key features and updates in the DensePose CSE implementation, including file paths to cycle consistency losses, evaluator, dataset links and model zoo references.
